{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3490769,"name":"Emil","username":"GronkBaby","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/g/ba8739/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-23T16:55:57.518Z","cooked":"

Hi everyone. I’m trying to get localization going using the SwerveDrivePoseEstimator class, but whenever the camera starts seeing a tag, the pose starts to orbit with an increasing radius until it orbits with a radius of infinity. The limelights aren’t giving garbage data (pose seems correct and is corroborated by NetworkTables and limelight.local:5801) and odometry works on its own. Timestamps also seem correct from the limelight camera (FPGA minus a little bit due to the latency).

Any ideas what could be causing these issues?

Here’s my github repo if that helps: GitHub - TheControlsExpert/CompetitionD1

Here’s some videos of the pose orbiting:

[3 new items added to shared album] Pose Issues

Any help would be greatly appreciated

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2025-01-23T20:13:09.326Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":18,"reads":201,"readers_count":200,"score":130.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":483228,"topic_slug":"swerve-pose-tornadoes-and-diverges-to-infinity-when-seeing-apriltags","display_username":"Emil","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":4,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://photos.app.goo.gl/siMsjEB8ZuAWgaeY9","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":156},{"url":"https://github.com/TheControlsExpert/CompetitionD1","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"GitHub - TheControlsExpert/CompetitionD1","clicks":7}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64351,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/swerve-pose-tornadoes-and-diverges-to-infinity-when-seeing-apriltags/483228/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3490800,"name":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/slab-mr.thomas/{size}/182153_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-23T17:25:14.549Z","cooked":"

There are several different named spirals and yours looks a lot like a Logarithmic Spiral. Sorry that may not be very helpful but they are made by successive multiplication of values that apparently you didn’t intend to multiply.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2025-01-23T17:25:14.549Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":177,"readers_count":176,"score":40.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":483228,"topic_slug":"swerve-pose-tornadoes-and-diverges-to-infinity-when-seeing-apriltags","display_username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Logarithmic_spiral","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Logarithmic spiral - Wikipedia","clicks":6}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24594,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/swerve-pose-tornadoes-and-diverges-to-infinity-when-seeing-apriltags/483228/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3490803,"name":"Emil","username":"GronkBaby","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/g/ba8739/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-23T17:27:43.341Z","cooked":"

@SLAB-Mr.Thomas

But all I call is addVisionMeasurement with the LL given pose, and the odometry pose which I know is right bcs it works on its own. What you’re saying makes sense, I just don’t see how that would work with my code.

Unless there is something weird going on with the calculated K-matrix, which happens in the back-end of the SwerveDrivePoseEstimator class, I don’t think (but am happy to be proven wrong) its that.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2025-01-23T17:29:37.274Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":170,"readers_count":169,"score":39.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":483228,"topic_slug":"swerve-pose-tornadoes-and-diverges-to-infinity-when-seeing-apriltags","display_username":"Emil","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":24594,"username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","name":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/slab-mr.thomas/{size}/182153_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64351,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/swerve-pose-tornadoes-and-diverges-to-infinity-when-seeing-apriltags/483228/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3490805,"name":"Owen Busler","username":"Owen_Busler","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/owen_busler/{size}/7684_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-23T17:30:40.590Z","cooked":"
GronkBaby:

ddVisionMeasurement with the LL given pose, and the odometry pose which I know is right bcs it works on its own. What you’re saying makes

Can you also visualize the LL given pose to see if that is the issue, or if the LL given pose makes sense but the poseEstimator is generating the spiral?

Also are you passing your odometry pose to addVisionMeasurement?

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2025-01-23T17:30:40.590Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":148,"readers_count":147,"score":34.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":483228,"topic_slug":"swerve-pose-tornadoes-and-diverges-to-infinity-when-seeing-apriltags","display_username":"Owen Busler","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":23320,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/swerve-pose-tornadoes-and-diverges-to-infinity-when-seeing-apriltags/483228/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3490806,"name":"Emil","username":"GronkBaby","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/g/ba8739/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-23T17:32:42.220Z","cooked":"

@Owen_Busler

Yes I add the odometry. I’ll upload videos of odometry and vision by themselves now.

I’m pretty sure its the poseEstimator generating the spiral, not my poses.

@Owen_Busler
I added a vid of the LL pose, there’s a comment under the vid that says its the one for the stable LL pose (without odometry, no sensor fusion, just from LL).

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2025-01-23T17:42:00.230Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":123,"readers_count":122,"score":39.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":483228,"topic_slug":"swerve-pose-tornadoes-and-diverges-to-infinity-when-seeing-apriltags","display_username":"Emil","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":64351,"username":"GronkBaby","name":"Emil","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/g/ba8739/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64351,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/swerve-pose-tornadoes-and-diverges-to-infinity-when-seeing-apriltags/483228/6","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3490848,"name":"Gavin Matthews","username":"bovlb","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bovlb/{size}/167232_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-23T18:33:06.582Z","cooked":"

I wonder if stddevs has invalid values, and this is confusing the Kalman filter into over-adjusting. You could test this by checking the values on the dashboard, or by hard-coding them to, say, (.5,.5,9999999).

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2025-01-23T18:33:06.582Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":104,"readers_count":103,"score":30.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":483228,"topic_slug":"swerve-pose-tornadoes-and-diverges-to-infinity-when-seeing-apriltags","display_username":"Gavin Matthews","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":38743,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Programming mentor, Team 2102, RI, CSA (he/him)"},"post_url":"/t/swerve-pose-tornadoes-and-diverges-to-infinity-when-seeing-apriltags/483228/7","custom_user_title":"Programming mentor, Team 2102, RI, CSA (he/him)","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3490874,"name":"Emil","username":"GronkBaby","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/g/ba8739/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-23T18:56:20.140Z","cooked":"

@bovlb

I can see the stddevs and they seem fine. I tried making sure they’re not 0 and that didn’t fix it. I tried using default stddevs, so just not changing them every time I add a vision measurement. Nothing works

I’ve also had this issue before last year on completely different code, roborio, and different camera. Guess it’s just me ha ha

Edit: I’ve also now tried setting the vision stddevs to a a known vector (0.05, 0.05, 9999) every single call of addvisionmeasurement() and still no success.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2025-01-23T18:59:08.350Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":91,"readers_count":90,"score":28.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":483228,"topic_slug":"swerve-pose-tornadoes-and-diverges-to-infinity-when-seeing-apriltags","display_username":"Emil","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":38743,"username":"bovlb","name":"Gavin Matthews","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bovlb/{size}/167232_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64351,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/swerve-pose-tornadoes-and-diverges-to-infinity-when-seeing-apriltags/483228/8","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"thinking","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3491427,"name":"Emil","username":"GronkBaby","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/g/ba8739/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-24T05:26:48.474Z","cooked":"

Due to my lack of understanding of how the pose estimator class works, I’m just going to make my own that I can more easily debug - similar to Orbit’s FOM system.

Although if anyone knows why I’m having the issue with the spiral, I would still be VERY happy to know

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2025-01-24T05:27:38.643Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":77,"readers_count":76,"score":20.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":483228,"topic_slug":"swerve-pose-tornadoes-and-diverges-to-infinity-when-seeing-apriltags","display_username":"Emil","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":64351,"username":"GronkBaby","name":"Emil","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/g/ba8739/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64351,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/swerve-pose-tornadoes-and-diverges-to-infinity-when-seeing-apriltags/483228/9","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3491456,"name":"Amicus1","username":"Amicus1","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/a9adbd/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-24T06:45:58.348Z","cooked":"

In my experience, this is caused by trying to reconcile a tag observation with a non-matching gyro reading. Are you using MegaTag 2?

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2025-01-24T06:45:58.348Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":67,"readers_count":66,"score":63.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":483228,"topic_slug":"swerve-pose-tornadoes-and-diverges-to-infinity-when-seeing-apriltags","display_username":"Amicus1","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":64351,"username":"GronkBaby","name":"Emil","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/g/ba8739/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":33946,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6995A/Choreo/Monologue"},"post_url":"/t/swerve-pose-tornadoes-and-diverges-to-infinity-when-seeing-apriltags/483228/10","custom_user_title":"6995A/Choreo/Monologue","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":true,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3491463,"name":"Emil","username":"GronkBaby","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/g/ba8739/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-24T07:08:36.796Z","cooked":"

@Amicus1

Yes. So are you saying that the pose that the camera gives has the wrong gyro and that’s the issue? It is the wrong reading, BCS it returns the pose of the camera not the bot, but I thought since the Std is infinite it doesn’t matter…

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2025-01-24T07:08:45.353Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":10,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":62,"readers_count":61,"score":22.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":483228,"topic_slug":"swerve-pose-tornadoes-and-diverges-to-infinity-when-seeing-apriltags","display_username":"Emil","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":33946,"username":"Amicus1","name":"Amicus1","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/a9adbd/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64351,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/swerve-pose-tornadoes-and-diverges-to-infinity-when-seeing-apriltags/483228/11","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3491694,"name":"Emil","username":"GronkBaby","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/g/ba8739/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-24T16:45:59.128Z","cooked":"

@Amicus1 it worked!!! I still don’t know why it works but here’s how I fixed it: even though the LL pose was correct and the odometry pose was correct, the LL gyro was 180 degrees off the navX gyro and robot pose rotation, BCS the camera was 180 degrees rotated (on the back of the robot). I would pass the pose either way BCS the rotation of the LL doesn’t matter since its std is 99999 (so I thought it wouldn’t have an effect). I changed this now by, after getting the LL pose, offsetting its rotation by 180 degrees, then passing it in through addVisionMeasurement(). Now it works
